intro: Thalictrum monticola, commonly known as the mountain meadow rue, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in upright clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Thalictrum monticola thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
